Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03896-7

Distinctive sounds of Martian 'micro-lightning' recorded by NASA’s Perseverance rover for the first time — plus, the final outcomes of the UN’s COP30 cli…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03896-7 Distinctive sounds of Martian 'micro-lightning' recorded by NASA’s Perseverance rover for the first time — plus, the final outcomes of the UN’s COP30 climate conference.

title: These ‘programmable’ knots harness physics to make surgical stitches safer
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03892-x

Loops precisely knotted into thread can help novice surgeons to perform perfect sutures.
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03892-x Loops precisely knotted into thread can help novice surgeons to perform perfect sutures.

title: NSD2 targeting reverses plasticity and drug resistance in prostate cancer
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09727-z

Inhibition of the histone methyltransferase NSD2 and the androgen receptor in preclinical models can reverse lineage plasticity to suppress tumour growth…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09727-z Inhibition of the histone methyltransferase NSD2 and the androgen receptor in preclinical models can reverse lineage plasticity to suppress tumour growth and promote cell death in multiple subtypes of castration-resistant prostate cancer.

title: Ferroelectric transistors for low-power NAND flash memory
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09793-3

Ultralow-power ferroelectric field-effect transistors are used to achieve low-power NAND flash memory, overcoming the trade-off between multi-level capab…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09793-3 Ultralow-power ferroelectric field-effect transistors are used to achieve low-power NAND flash memory, overcoming the trade-off between multi-level capability and power efficiency and paving the way for next-generation storage memory.

title: Slipknot-gauged mechanical transmission and robotic operation
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09673-w

A mechano-intelligent transmission mechanism based on the slipknot delivers precise force signals for clinical practice and robotic operations such as mi…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09673-w A mechano-intelligent transmission mechanism based on the slipknot delivers precise force signals for clinical practice and robotic operations such as minimally invasive surgery and tendon-driven robotics.

title: iHALT unlocks liver functionality as a surrogate secondary lymphoid organ
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09803-4

Liver-restricted viral infection in mice results in secondary lymphoid organ dormancy and the compensatory induction of specialized lymphoid tissue in th…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09803-4 Liver-restricted viral infection in mice results in secondary lymphoid organ dormancy and the compensatory induction of specialized lymphoid tissue in the liver, the structural features and functional outputs of which are closely mirrored in humans.

title: Inhibitors supercharge kinase turnover through native proteolytic circuits
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09763-9

Inhibitor-induced kinase degradation is a common event that positions supercharging of endogenous degradation circuits as an alternative to classical pro…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09763-9 Inhibitor-induced kinase degradation is a common event that positions supercharging of endogenous degradation circuits as an alternative to classical proximity-inducing degraders.

title: Ancient DNA from Shimao city records kinship practices in Neolithic China
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09799-x

Sequencing of 144 ancient genomes from Shimao city and its satellites presents pedigrees among tomb owners spanning up to four generations showing predom…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09799-x Sequencing of 144 ancient genomes from Shimao city and its satellites presents pedigrees among tomb owners spanning up to four generations showing predominantly patrilineal descent structure across Shimao communities, and possibly sex-specific sacrificial rituals.

title: New finds shed light on diet and locomotion in Australopithecus deyiremeda
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09714-4

3.4-million-year-old hominin fossils discovered in Ethiopia provide insight into the diet and locomotion of Australopithecus deyiremeda.
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09714-4 3.4-million-year-old hominin fossils discovered in Ethiopia provide insight into the diet and locomotion of Australopithecus deyiremeda.

title: Glasses-free 3D display with ultrawide viewing range using deep learning
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09752-y

A glasses-free three-dimensional display, which is as large as a conventional desktop screen and has a viewing angle larger than 100°, is achieved by an …
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09752-y A glasses-free three-dimensional display, which is as large as a conventional desktop screen and has a viewing angle larger than 100°, is achieved by an artificial intelligence-powered optimization algorithm, which adapts the virtual images sent around each eye in real time.

title: Detection of triboelectric discharges during dust events on Mars
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09736-y

The SuperCam microphone aboard the Perseverance rover captured 55 triboelectric discharges during dust events on Mars over two Martian years, providing i…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09736-y The SuperCam microphone aboard the Perseverance rover captured 55 triboelectric discharges during dust events on Mars over two Martian years, providing implications for examining the planet’s surface chemistry, habitability and human exploration.

title: Progressive coevolution of the yeast centromere and kinetochore
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09779-1

Thousands of centromeres were identified and tracked across two major fungal clades, showing that new centromeres spread progressively and that the kinet…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09779-1 Thousands of centromeres were identified and tracked across two major fungal clades, showing that new centromeres spread progressively and that the kinetochore acts as a filter to determine which new centromere variants are tolerated.

title: Long-read metagenomics reveals phage dynamics in the human gut microbiome
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09786-2

Complex prophage integration dynamics, including low-level induction, cross-family host range and transposase-mediated mobilization, challenge existing p…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09786-2 Complex prophage integration dynamics, including low-level induction, cross-family host range and transposase-mediated mobilization, challenge existing paradigms and deepen our understanding of phage–bacterial interactions in the human gut microbiome.

title: A distinctive human genetic lineage persisted in central Argentina for 8,500 years
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03649-6

The DNA of ancient individuals dating to between 10,000 and 150 years ago reveals the existence of a long-standing, yet previously uncharacterized, linea…
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03649-6 The DNA of ancient individuals dating to between 10,000 and 150 years ago reveals the existence of a long-standing, yet previously uncharacterized, lineage in the Southern Cone of South America — a region comprising what is now Argentina, Chile and Uruguay. People with this ancestry produced offspring with other, pre-existing groups in surrounding regions. Genomic data from present-day inhabitants attest to the genetic continuity of the lineage in central Argentina.

title: Mystery owner of African hominin foot identified
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03451-4

Fossils newly discovered in Ethiopia indicate that previously unidentified foot bones belong to the ancient human relative Australopithecus deyiremeda.
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03451-4 Fossils newly discovered in Ethiopia indicate that previously unidentified foot bones belong to the ancient human relative Australopithecus deyiremeda.

title: ‘They don’t have symptoms’: CAR-T therapies send autoimmune diseases into remission
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03885-w

Engineered T cells that have been used to treat ulcerative colitis, rheumatoid arthritis and lupus show promising results.
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03885-w Engineered T cells that have been used to treat ulcerative colitis, rheumatoid arthritis and lupus show promising results.

body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03786-y History repeating.

title: Is there lightning on Mars?
summary:
Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03590-8

The Perseverance rover on Mars has serendipitously recorded sounds and electromagnetic signals that are characteristic of lightning in dust storms.
body: Nature, Published online: 26 November 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03590-8 The Perseverance rover on Mars has serendipitously recorded sounds and electromagnetic signals that are characteristic of lightning in dust storms.
